retrieved_context:
name: Clouds
type: Natural Phenomenon
description: Clouds are visible masses of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere, formed through various processes involving temperature, humidity, and air currents. name: different types of clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: Different types of clouds, such as cumulus, stratus, and cirrus, are formed through the interaction of various meteorological factors. name: Stratus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: Low-lying clouds that form in a more uniform layer across the sky, often gray and can bring overcast skies and light rain. name: cloud formation
type: Atmospheric Process
description: Cloud formation is a complex process involving the interaction of various factors such as temperature, humidity, and air currents. Clouds form when warm, moist air rises and cools to its dew point. name: clouds
type: Atmospheric Phenomenon
description: Clouds are visible accumulations of tiny water droplets or ice crystals in the atmosphere. name: Cirrus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: High, wispy clouds composed of ice crystals, often seen in the sky on clear days. name: Sky
type: Natural Phenomenon
description: The sky is the atmosphere and outer space as viewed from Earth, often appearing blue during the day due to the scattering of sunlight. It serves as a canvas for various atmospheric phenomena such as clouds. name: Dew Point
type: Meteorological Concept
description: The dew point is the temperature at which water vapor in the air begins to condense into liquid water. name: Air Currents
type: Environmental Factor
description: Air currents are movements of air in the atmosphere, affecting the distribution and movement of clouds. name: air currents
type: Atmospheric Phenomenon
description: Air currents are movements of air in the atmosphere. They can be horizontal (winds) or vertical (updrafts and downdrafts). name: Cloud Formation
type: Meteorological Process
description: The process by which clouds are formed in the atmosphere. name: Temperature
type: Environmental Factor
description: Temperature is a measure of heat or cold in an environment, affecting the rate of condensation and evaporation. name: Humidity
type: Environmental Factor
description: Humidity is the amount of water vapor present in the air, influencing cloud formation. name: Warming of Earth"s Surface
type: Environmental Process
description: The warming of the Earth"s surface by the sun is a fundamental process that initiates cloud formation.

description: Humidity is the amount of water vapor present in the air, influencing cloud formation. name: Warming of Earth"s Surface
type: Environmental Process
description: The warming of the Earth"s surface by the sun is a fundamental process that initiates cloud formation.

correct_answer: Cirrus clouds are high, wispy clouds.
retrieved_context:
name: Clouds
type: Natural Phenomenon
description: Clouds are visible masses of water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the atmosphere, formed through various processes involving temperature, humidity, and air currents. name: different types of clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: Different types of clouds, such as cumulus, stratus, and cirrus, are formed through the interaction of various meteorological factors. name: Stratus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: Low-lying clouds that form in a more uniform layer across the sky, often gray and can bring overcast skies and light rain. name: cloud formation
type: Atmospheric Process
description: Cloud formation is a complex process involving the interaction of various factors such as temperature, humidity, and air currents. Clouds form when warm, moist air rises and cools to its dew point. name: clouds
type: Atmospheric Phenomenon
description: Clouds are visible accumulations of tiny water droplets or ice crystals in the atmosphere. name: Cirrus Clouds
type: Cloud Type
description: High, wispy clouds composed of ice crystals, often seen in the sky on clear days. name: High Altitudes
type: Atmospheric Layer
description: The upper part of the atmosphere where conditions are very cold and dry. name: Sky
type: Natural Phenomenon
description: The sky is the atmosphere and outer space as viewed from Earth, often appearing blue during the day due to the scattering of sunlight. It serves as a canvas for various atmospheric phenomena such as clouds. name: Dew Point
type: Meteorological Concept
description: The dew point is the temperature at which water vapor in the air begins to condense into liquid water. name: Air Currents
type: Environmental Factor
description: Air currents are movements of air in the atmosphere, affecting the distribution and movement of clouds. name: air currents
type: Atmospheric Phenomenon
description: Air currents are movements of air in the atmosphere. They can be horizontal (winds) or vertical (updrafts and downdrafts). name: Temperature
type: Environmental Factor
description: Temperature is a measure of heat or cold in an environment, affecting the rate of condensation and evaporation. name: Humidity
type: Environmental Factor
description: Humidity is the amount of water vapor present in the air, influencing cloud formation. name: Warming of Earth"s Surface
type: Environmental Process
description: The warming of the Earth"s surface by the sun is a fundamental process that initiates cloud formation.
